author: .paulharris
content: https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-APIs/issues/50 maybe we should discuss this suggestion before the api goes too far down the track - basically a tweak to the duties endpoints

author: jgm
content: Making public keys optional for the attester endpoint could be an option but not sure if that would be considered too expensive a call to be the default.

author: .paulharris
content: i was thinking potentially just adding optional pubkeys on the proposer and making it a post instead of get (because of potential number of keys to submit)

author: .paulharris
content: im keen on not having the attester duties get out of control ideally

author: jgm
content: Given that we have 32 proposers per epoch a filter seems overkill

author: .paulharris
content: yep, so it'd only be to offload the processing, and just get a list of proposers you're actually interested in, from a client perspective

author: .paulharris
content: so as a client you get back an empty list from your api call, you know you're not proposing anything this epoch

author: .paulharris
content: thats the only use case i can think of, just for doing less on the client after the fact

author: jgm
content: There are two use cases I see: get everything, and get just what I'm interested in. The latter would surely be quicker with client-side filtering than shipping over the list of validators, especially if you have more than a few validators to check.

author: .paulharris
content: seems like a slim use case to justify changing a GET to a POST and having an optional param processing i guess heh
